venue.name: National Association for Armenian Studies & Research

item.description:
Katrina Scott, ESB member and Ethical Culture Officiant, is an Oncology Chaplain at the Massachusetts General Hospital in Boston.

Who are the “nones”, the religiously unaffiliated, and what does that mean? Join Katrina Scott in a conversation about the recent survey, conducted in 2012 by the Pew Forum on Religion and Public Life, which documents a rise in the number of people identifying themselves as non-affiliated with a particular religion.The Pew Forum study found that about 20% of adult Americans have no religious affiliation. That figure represents an increase of roughly 5% since 2007. Katrina will explore the trends behind the numbers, and discuss what they say about the Humanism and secularism in America today.
item.name: The Rise of the "Nones”
